page.title: 13Private rural bus service
page.content:
Every day a large{minibus}wends its way{from Romford}in Essex{to Sevenoaks in Kent via the{Dartford Tunnel. }Its route takes it through{West Kingsdown. Nothing remarkable in that. Except that this is a{long established route which has always been{operated by a {private firm.} Only the liberalising regime of the 1980's has enabled any significant development of private bus routes.
The{operating company}is a{small coach {hire firm}based on the outskirts of {West Kingsdown}and this is the only bus route it operates. The longevity of the service proves the viability of what seems to be a meandering route connecting villages and towns to which no particular affinity would appear to exist.
